chainsaw.active.reducesaw — Reducing chainsaw¶

class chainsaw.active.reducesaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

reducing chainsaw

append(thing)¶

Insert thing after any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – incoming thing
appendstart(thing)¶

Insert thing before any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – incoming thing
arguments(*args, **kw)¶

Assign global positional or keyword arguments used when the worker is invoked.

as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode outgoing things with the 'ascii' codec.

Parameters:errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
classmethod as_auto()¶

Switch to context where incoming things are automatically rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for encoding issues
as_dict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to dict.

as_edit()¶

Start session where work is performed on incoming things without automatically reverting back to an earlier baseline snapshot when invoking the results() or iterating over outgoing things.

as_list()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to list.

classmethod as_manual()¶

Switch to context where incoming things must be manually rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_many()¶

Switch to working on each incoming thing as one individual thing among many.

as_one()¶

Switch to working on all incoming things as one whole thing.

as_query()¶

Switch to session where, upon exiting it by invoking results() or end() or iterating over outgoing things, incoming things automatically revert back to an earlier baseline snapshot.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to set.

as_tuple()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to tuple.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to unicode (str under Python 3) decode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
balanced¶

Whether outgoing things and incoming things are in balance.

clear()¶

Remove everything.

clear_in()¶

Remove incoming things.

clear_out()¶

Remove outgoing things.

end()¶

End the current session and return outgoing things wrapped with the iterable wrapper.

extend(things)¶

Insert things after any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
extendstart(things)¶

Insert things before any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
flatten()¶

Flatten nested things within an iterable.

in_out()¶

Copy incoming things to outgoing things.

merge()¶

Combine multiple iterables into one iterable.

out_in()¶

Copy outgoing things to incoming things.

pattern(pattern, type='parse', flags=0)¶

Compile a search pattern and use it as the worker.

Parameters:
  • pattern (string) – search pattern
  • type (string) – engine to compile pattern with. Valid options are ‘parse’, ‘re’, or ‘glob’
  • flags (integer) – regular expression flags
preview()¶

Take a peek at the current state of outgoing things.

reduce(initial=None, reverse=False)¶

Reduce an iterable down to one thing using the worker.

Parameters:
  • initial – starting value
  • reverse (boolean) – reduce from the right side of an iterable
results()¶

Clear and return outgoing things wrapped with the iterable wrapper. Also ends query sessions.

snapshot(baseline=False, original=False)¶

Take a snapshot of current incoming things.

Parameters:
  • baseline (boolean) – make snapshot the baseline snapshot
  • original (boolean) – make snapshot the original snapshot
tap(call)¶

Assign worker.

Parameters:call (callable) – a callable
undo(snapshot=0, baseline=False, original=False)¶

Revert incoming things back to a previous snapshot.

Parameters:
  • snapshot (integer) – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3
  • baseline (boolean) – revert incoming things to baseline snapshot
  • original (boolean) – revert incoming things to original snapshot
untap()¶

Remove worker and global positional and keyword arguments.

unwrap()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to list.

weave()¶

Interleave things found at the same position across multiple iterables while reducing multiple iterables to one.

wrap(wrapper)¶

Set iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

Parameters:wrapper –

an iterable wrapper
zip()¶

Reduce multiple iterables to one iterable by pairing every two things as a tuple of (thing1, thing2).
